Package com.mitsuki.jmatrix.core

Interface MatrixUtils

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Matrix
    public interface MatrixUtils
    Utility interface for matrix operations and other utilities. All methods in this interface has their own default implementation.
    Since:
    1.0.0b.7
    Version:
    1.2, 26 June 2023
    Author:
    Ryuu Mitsuki
    License:
    Apache License 2.0
    See Also:
    Matrix

    • Method Detail

      • deepCopyOf

        static Matrix deepCopyOf​(Matrix m)
        Creates and returns a deep copy of the given Matrix.

        If the given matrix has null entries (unitialized), then it would returns new matrix with null entries instead.

        Since:
        1.0.0b.7
        Parameters:
        m - the Matrix object.
        Returns:
        a new Matrix object that is a deep copy of the input matrix.
        See Also:
        deepCopyOf(double[][]), Matrix.deepCopy()

      • deepCopyOf

        static double[][] deepCopyOf​(double[][] a)
        Creates and returns a deep copy of the given two-dimensional array.

        If the given array null or empty, then it would returns null instead.

        Since:
        1.0.0b.7
        Parameters:
        a - the two-dimensional array to be copied.
        Returns:
        a new two-dimensional array that is a deep copy of the input array.
        See Also:
        deepCopyOf(Matrix)

      • isEqualsSize

        static boolean isEqualsSize​(Matrix a,
                            Matrix b)
        Checks whether the given two matrices have equal sizes.

        Returns false if any of the following statements is true:

        • One or both matrices are null object or have null entries.
        • Both matrices have different sizes, either in terms of row size or column size.
        Since:
        1.0.0b.7
        Parameters:
        a - the first Matrix to compare.
        b - the second Matrix to compare.
        Returns:
        true if both matrices have equal sizes, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isEqualsSize(double[][], double[][]), isEquals(Matrix, Matrix)

      • isEqualsSize

        static boolean isEqualsSize​(double[][] a,
                            double[][] b)
        Checks whether the given two-dimensional arrays have equal sizes.

        Returns false if any of the following statements is true:

        • One or both arrays are null object or empty.
        • Both arrays have different sizes, either in terms of row size or column size.
        Since:
        1.0.0b.7
        Parameters:
        a - the first two-dimensional array to compare.
        b - the second two-dimensional array to compare.
        Returns:
        true if the arrays have equal sizes, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isEqualsSize(Matrix, Matrix), isEquals(double[][], double[][])

      • isEquals

        static boolean isEquals​(Matrix a,
                        Matrix b)
        Checks whether the given two matrices are equal by comparing their entries.

        Returns false if any of the following statements is true:

        • One or both matrices are null object or have null entries.
        • Both matrices have different dimensions (number of rows and columns).
        • There exists an entry in one matrix that is not equal to the entry in the corresponding position in the other matrix.
        Since:
        1.0.0b.7
        Parameters:
        a - the first Matrix to compare.
        b - the second Matrix to compare.
        Returns:
        true if the matrices are equal, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isEquals(double[][], double[][]), isEqualsSize(Matrix, Matrix), Matrix.equals(Object)

      • isEquals

        static boolean isEquals​(double[][] a,
                        double[][] b)
        Checks whether the given two-dimensional arrays are equal by comparing their entries.

        Returns false if any of the following statements is true:

        • One or both arrays are null object or empty.
        • Both arrays have different dimensions (number of rows and columns).
        • There exists an entry in one array that is not equal to the entry in the corresponding position in the other array.
        Since:
        1.0.0b.7
        Parameters:
        a - the first two-dimensional array to compare.
        b - the second two-dimensional array to compare.
        Returns:
        true if the arrays are equal, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isEquals(Matrix, Matrix), isEqualsSize(double[][], double[][])

      • isNullEntries

        static boolean isNullEntries​(Matrix m)
        Checks whether the given Matrix has null entries.
        Since:
        1.0.0b.7
        Parameters:
        m - the Matrix object.
        Returns:
        true if the matrix has null entries, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Matrix.getEntries()
